botanical_details.genus: Phaseolus are annual or perennial legumes, usually climbing or trailing in form, and with trifoliate leaves. Grown as crop plants for their edible seeds, including runner, French and lima beans, as well as for animal feed, green manures and as ornamentals

how_to_grow.cultivation: Start from seed in a heated greenhouse or on a warm windowsill. Plant outside once all risk of frost has passed in a warm, sunny, sheltered site; incorporate well-rotted manure into soil before planting and keep the soil moist when plants are flowering to ensure good fruit set. Plants need substantial supports. See runner beans (Grow you own)
how_to_grow.pruning: Remove tips of shoots once they reach the top of the support
how_to_grow.pests: May be attacked by slugs and snails and black bean aphid. Birds may also be troublesome
how_to_grow.diseases: Generally disease-free but may be susceptible to foot rot
